name: Crescent Street A - North
description: The northern section of Crescent Street A is a transitional urban corridor in Cassandra, linking major avenues with older residential blocks. It hosts several important locations tied directly to recent incidents and personal histories.

snapshot.name: Crescent Street A - North
snapshot.location: Northern section of Crescent Street A, Cassandra
snapshot.description: Crescent Street A (North) is a relatively quiet street marked by aging buildings and limited foot traffic. While it appears unremarkable at first glance, several locations along this street are closely connected to past deaths and ongoing investigations. The atmosphere is subdued, with an underlying sense that the street has seen more than it reveals.

conditions.description: Streetlights are sparse and uneven, leaving long stretches of the street in dim light at night.
Occasional passing vehicles and distant city noise, otherwise unusually quiet.

exits.description: The street continues south into a busier and more active section of Crescent Street A.
A connecting road leads back toward Avenue of Stars, the city’s main thoroughfare.
A mid-sized hotel on Crescent Street A-N, known for a mysterious death that occurred the previous year.
A private residence belonging to Marcel, a former employee connected to recent events.

snapshot.keeperNotes: This street connects two investigation-heavy locations: Paradile Hotel and Marcel’s House. It works well as a pressure corridor—investigators may move repeatedly between these sites while feeling observed or followed.

connections.description: The hotel is located directly on Crescent Street A (North).
Marcel’s residence is situated along Crescent Street A (North).
A major route connecting this street to the city center.
